title: Hezbollah fighters shoot down an Israeli drone in Lebanon and fire rockets at an Israeli base
message:
Hezbollah fighters shoot down an Israeli drone in Lebanon and fire rockets at an Israeli baseA Lebanese man gestures as he inspects a destroyed house that was hit on Friday night by an Israeli airstrike, killing one woman and wounding several other people, in the southern village of Adloun, Lebanon, Saturday, June 1, 2024.
(AP Photo/Mohammad Zaatari)BEIRUT (AP) — The militant Hezbollah group said it shot down an Israeli drone over southern Lebanon and fired rockets at an Israeli military base on Saturday, hours after Israeli drone strikes killed at least one person and wounded several others.
The Israeli military said a surface-to-air missile was fired toward a drone operating in Lebanese airspace, adding that it was hit and fell in Lebanese territory.
Earlier Saturday, an Israeli drone strike on a motorcycle near the southern Lebanese village of Khirbet Selm wounded two people, state-run National News Agency said.
Hezbollah began attacking Israeli military posts along the Lebanon-Israel border a day after the Israel-Hamas war broke out on Oct. 7.

title: Poland reports  long and tense night  during Russian attack on Ukraine
message:
Poland reports "long and tense night" during Russian attack on UkraineOperational Command of the Polish Armed Forces has said that its own and allied aircraft were scrambled on the night of 31 May-1 June in response to the threat of Russian missile attacks on Ukrainian territory.
"It was a long and tense night for the entire air defence system of Poland," Polish Army Operational Command noted.
The deployment of Polish and allied aircraft ended at 06:00 as the threat of missile strikes by Russian aircraft on Ukrainian territory lessened.
"The Polish army is continuously monitoring the situation on Ukrainian territory and is on constant combat alert to ensure the security of Polish airspace," they stated.
This is not the first time Poland has scrambled fighter jets in connection with Russia's missile strikes on the territory of Ukraine.
event_breakdown: Poland reports tense night during Russia's missile attack on Ukraine

message:
German police officer still in serious condition after knife attackForensics officers inspect the crime scene where a knife-wielding attacker in the German city of Mannheim on Friday targeted a gathering by the anti-Islam right-wing group Pax Europa, according to members of the group.

message:

title: Houthis Claim Red Sea Attack on American Aircraft Carrier After US - UK Strikes
message:
Houthis Claim Red Sea Attack on American Aircraft Carrier After US-UK StrikesSputnik News20240531DOHA (Sputnik) - Yemen's Ansar Allah movement, also known as Houthis, has launched missile and UAV attacks on a US aircraft carrier in the Red Sea in response to the bombing of the country, Houthi political office member Hezam al-Asad told Sputnik on Friday.
Late on Thursday, US and UK military aircraft carried out 13 strikes on positions the Houthis in three provinces of Yemen after a series of attacks on US ships in the Red, Arabian and Mediterranean seas.
A source in Al Hudaydah authorities told Sputnik at least two people were killed and 10 others were injured in the strikes.
Houthi military spokesman Yahya Saree said on Friday that the US and the UK attack on the Red Sea province of Al Hudaydah killed 16 people and wounded 41 others, including civilians.

By U.S. Africa Command Public Affairs , United States Africa Command Stuttgart, Germany May 31, 2024In coordination with the Federal Government of Somalia, U.S. Africa Command conducted an airstrike in Somalia targeting ISIS militants, May 31, 2024.

title: Russian glide bomb strike on Myrnohrad injures at least 5
message:
Russian forces attacked the town of Myrnohrad in Donetsk Oblast with two glide bombs on the evening of May 31, injuring at least five people, the Donetsk Oblast Prosecutor's Office said on June 1.
The injured people received medical attention, the prosecutor's office said.
Myrnohrad, which is located some 70 kilometers (43 miles) from the Russian-occupied regional capital of Donetsk, is regularly targeted in Russian attacks.
A Russian strike on the city on March 13 killed two people and injured five more.
Three days before, a Russian missile attack on Myrnohrad injured 10 people.

message:
articleA Sheboygan police officer shot a stabbing suspect, who allegedly charged at officers with a knife, on Friday, May 31.

An officer first retreated and tried using "less-lethal means of incapacitating the suspect," police said, before shooting the suspect one time.

The Israeli military said a surface-to-air missile was fired toward a drone operating in Lebanese airspace, adding that it was hit and fell in Lebanese territory.
Earlier Saturday, an Israeli drone strike on a motorcycle near the southern Lebanese village of Khirbet Selm wounded two people, state-run National News Agency said.
Such strikes deep inside Lebanon and far away from the Israeli border have been rare since the latest round of fighting began nearly eight months ago.
Hezbollah began attacking Israeli military posts along the Lebanon-Israel border a day after the Israel-Hamas war broke out on Oct. 7.

Hezbollah shoots down Israeli drone, fires rockets at Israel

title: At Least 19 Injured as Russia Hits Ukraine Power Grid with Fresh Barrage
message:
Russia pummeled Ukraine's energy infrastructure with a large-scale drone and missile attack Saturday, injuring at least 19 people, local officials said.
Injuries were reported by officials across the country, including in Ukraine's western Lviv region and the central Dnipropetrovsk region.
The strikes were part of a series of sustained attacks by Russia against Ukraine's power grid, which has been ongoing since March.
Meanwhile, Ukraine's Energy Minister, Herman Halushchenko, said in a statement on social media that energy infrastructure in the Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Kirovohrad, and Ivano-Frankivsk regions had also been targeted.
Damage to Ukraine's energy infrastructure in recent weeks has forced leaders of the war-ravaged country to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.

title: Ukraine Air Force shoots down 35 out of 53 missiles and almost 50 Shahed UAVs
message:
Ukraine's Air Force shoots down 35 out of 53 missiles and almost 50 Shahed UAVsRussian forces carried out missile strikes and airstrikes on critical infrastructure facilities in several oblasts on the night of 31 May-1 June 2024, with Ukrainian defenders shooting down 35 missiles and 46 drones.
Source: Ukraine’s Air Force on TelegramDetails: The Russians fired a total of 53 different types of missiles and 47 assault UAVs.
- 35 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles from Tu-95 MS strategic aviation aircraft (launch area in Saratov Oblast and airspace over the Caspian Sea, Russian Federation);- four Iskander-M ballistic missiles (launched from Crimea);- one Iskander-K cruise missile (launched from Crimea);- ten Kalibr cruise missiles (launched from the north-eastern part of the Black Sea).
- three Kh-59/Kh-69 guided air missiles (launched from the airspace of the temporarily-occupied territory of Zaporizhzhia Oblast);- 47 Shahed-131/136 assault UAVs (launched from Primorsko-Akhtarsk launch location, Russian Federation).
As a result of the anti-aircraft combat, anti-aircraft missile units, fighter aircraft, electronic warfare units of the Air Force and mobile fire groups of the Ukrainian Defence Forces shot down:- 30 Kh-101/Kh-555 cruise missiles,- four Kalibr cruise missiles,- one Iskander-K cruise missile;- 46 Shahed-131/136 assault UAVs.

title: Ukraine war : Can using Western weapons on Russia change the war ?
message:
Ukraine is now allowed to use Western weapons to hit targets inside Russia.
Up until now, Western countries restricted the use of their weapons to military targets located inside Ukraine, including Crimea and occupied territories.
They were concerned that attacking targets across the internationally recognised border with weapons provided by Nato countries would escalate the conflict.
The border in this region is effectively the front line as well, so the ban on using Western weapons to hit targets beyond Ukraine enabled Russian troops to prepare for that operation in a safe environment.
Following the growing pressure from Ukraine and other European states, the US agreed to change its policy and allow Kyiv to strike Russia with Western weapons.
event_breakdown: Event 1: The Ukrainian army has been given permission to strike Russian targets using weapons provided by NATO countries, responding to demands to help their neighbour counter Russian aggression.

The U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM), which oversees American troops on the African continent, said the airstrike... read full story"An initial assessment of the strike is that three IS militants were killed, with no civilian casualties,"
event_breakdown:
MOGADISHU, June 1 (Xinhua) -- A joint airstrike carried out by the Somali and U.S. forces killed three Islamic State (IS)-Somalia fighters in the latest airstrike in northeastern Somalia on Friday evening.
The U.S. Africa Command (AFRICOM), which oversees American troops on the African continent, said the airstrike hit IS terrorists near Xiriiro in the lower Shabelle region, some 140 km southwest of the capital Mogadishu.
"Initial assessments indicate the villagers on the ground reported no civilian casualties," AFRICOM said in a statement.
The strike was conducted as a response in the support of the Federal Government of Somalia's continued efforts to degrade al-Shabaab and IS-Somalia in Somalia, said the statement obtained by Xinhua in Nairobi.
The statement added that the strike was conducted in coordination with Somalia's government.
AFRICOM said the mission was conducted in coordination with the Somali government, which is known in the U.S. as African Union Mission in Somalia (AMISOM), with the aim of targeting the al-Qaida-linked terror group al-Shabaab and IS-Somalia terrorist groups, which are both active in the country.

title: Houthi Rebels Claim Strike on USS Eisenhower amid U . S .- UK Operations in Yemen
message:
Yemen’s Houthi rebels have claimed a missile attack on the USS Dwight D. Eisenhower, a U.S. Navy aircraft carrier operating in the Red Sea.
The claim came after a series of coordinated U.S. and U.K. strikes against Houthi targets in Yemen, which reportedly resulted in multiple casualties.
On May 30 2024, the U.K. took part in a joint operation with U.S. forces to target Houthi military facilities in Yemen.
This operation took place in order to hinder the Houthi rebels’ capacity to attack international shipping in the Red Sea and Gulf of Aden.
The Houthi strikes on shipping are claimed to be in solidarity with Palestinians in Gaza and are seen as retaliatory measures against U.S.-led airstrikes.

Beirut, Lebanon - Lebanese Prime Minister Najib Mikati has submitted a complaint to the U.N. Security Council over an Israeli drone attack that wounded several schoolchildren. The attack, which Beirut claimed violated international humanitarian law, targeted a car, but shrapnel from a missile damaged a nearby minibus.

Foreign Minister Abdallah Bouhabib said the attack wounded two students from a nearby high school. He said the Lebanese government considered the attack an "irresponsible form of aggression and a dangerous violation of U.N. Security Council Resolution 1701", which ended a 2006 war between Israel and Hezbollah militants.

Israel has not commented on the incident.

Man in critical condition following stabbing Friday in CheektowagaA 25-year-old man is in critical condition in the intensive care unit at Erie County Medical Center following a stabbing Friday night, Cheektowaga police reported.
According to the report, the man was stabbed in the neck during a fight at the M Hotel, 2040 Walden Ave., Cheektowaga.
Officers arrived at the scene after a call at 10:45 p.m. and administered lifesaving measures before the man was taken to ECMC by ambulance.
Police arrested Zachary Turner, 28, of Blasdell, and charged him with first-degree assault and fourth-degree criminal possession of a weapon.
He was arraigned before Cheektowaga Town Justice John J. Wanat and remanded to the Erie County Holding Center.

The sources, who spoke anonymously, said, one Hezbollah member was killed and another wounded, in an Israeli attack in the town of Ain Qana, while another Israeli raid, in the town of Adloun, in the Sidon district, killed a woman and wounded four other civilians.

title: Israel confirms its forces are in central Rafah , defying international condemnation of operation in southern Gazan city
message:
CNNBy Tamar Michaelis and Rob Picheta, CNN(CNN) — The Israeli military is in central Rafah, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) confirmed in a statement Friday, despite international concern and anger over its military operation in Gaza’s southernmost city.
The IDF statement confirms what eyewitnesses told CNN earlier this week, when tanks were spotted in central Rafah for the first time since it entered the city earlier this month.
“IDF troops in central Rafah located Hamas rocket launchers, terror tunnel shafts, and weapons.
The troops also dismantled a Hamas weapons storage facility in the area,” the IDF said in the statement.
Over the weekend, Israel launched an airstrike on a displacement camp in the city, killing dozens and creating global outrage.
event_breakdown: IDF troops in central Rafah located Hamas rocket launchers, terror tunnel shafts, and weapons. The troops also dismantled a Hamas weapons storage facility in the area.

title: Fire at Vinnytsia infrastructure site caused by UAV wreckage
message:
A fire broke out at an energy facility in Vinnytsia OblastA fire erupted at a crucial infrastructure site in Vinnytsia Oblast due to fragments from a downed Russian UAV, Serhiy Borzov, the head of the Vinnytsia Oblast Administration, reported on the night of June 1.
The Ministry of Energy noted that five oblasts were targeted, significantly impacting Ukraine's energy infrastructure.
DTEK, a major Ukrainian energy company, reported substantial damage to two of its thermal power plants, marking this as the sixth significant attack on the power system since March 2024.
The attacks caused extensive damage to the power systems in regions including Vinnytsia, Kirovohrad, and Ivano-Frankivsk.
Additionally, Ivan Fedorov, head of the Zaporizhzhya Regional Administration, reported that an energy infrastructure facility in Zaporizhzhya was hit, resulting in traffic disruptions at the Dniprovska Hydro Power Plant.

title: At least 19 injured as Russia hits Ukraine power grid with fresh barrage
message:
At least 19 injured as Russia hits Ukraine’s power grid with fresh barrageKYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russia pummeled Ukraine’s energy infrastructure with a large-scale drone and missile attack Saturday, injuring at least 19 people, local officials said.
Injuries were reported by officials across the country, including in Ukraine’s western Lviv region and the central Dnipropetrovsk region.
The strikes were part of a series of sustained attacks by Russia against Ukraine’s power grid, which has been ongoing since March.
Meanwhile, Ukraine’s Energy Minister, Herman Halushchenko, said in a statement on social media that energy infrastructure in the Zaporizhzhia, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, Kirovohrad and Ivano-Frankivsk regions had also been targeted.
Damage to Ukraine’s energy infrastructure in recent weeks has forced leaders of the war-ravaged country to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.

Blazer’s men seized the two inebriated fellows, and maybe the applejack, and accused them of belonging to Mosby’s command.
Blazer’s men emerged from the woods behind the encamped Confederates like avenging wraiths as the Rangers scrambled to mount their horses.
Blazer’s command suffered five casualties—one dead, four wounded—and claimed to have killed six of Mosby’s men and one officer, wounded four more, and captured six Rangers.

message:

A genealogist touring a German military cemetery noticed Baskind's name on a plaque under three crosses and contacted Operation Benjamin, an organization that works to identify Jewish American soldiers buried under incorrect religious markers.
The German War Grave Commission - the Volksbund - reported locating one of Baskind's identification tags and portions of American military clothing, but failed to identify his remains.

title: Steve Phillips Obituary
message:
PHILLIPS, JR., STEVE F., Colonel Steve Franklin Phillips, Jr., 86, passed away October 8, 2006.
In 1964 he was selected as the Battalion Commander of 1st Battalion, 2d Infantry of the 5th Infantry Division and began training his battalion for the eventual deployment to the Republic of Vietnam.
In September 1965, his battalion was sent to Vietnam and reflagged under the 1st Infantry Division where he remained the commander for 6 months and was then promoted to Colonel and designated as the 1st Brigade Commander, 1st Infantry Division.
He also was a member of the Society of the 1st Division; Worshipful Master of the Hancock Masonic Lodge No.
Steve is survived by his loving wife of 61 years, Frances Eileen Phillips; daughter, Myra Gene Keleher and her husband Dennis ; sons, Steve F. Phillips, III, and John W. Phillips; brother, David Phillips; sisters, Clovis Steele, and Marian Phillips; grandchildren, Shannon Keleher, Amanda Keleher, Steve F. Phillips, IV, and Luis-Andrés Phillips.

title: UN says Gaza aid not reaching the population

The humanitarian aid allowed into the Gaza Strip is not getting to civilians in need, the United Nations said Friday, urging Israel to fulfil its legal obligations.
"The aid that is getting in is not getting to the people, and that's a major problem," Jens Laerke, spokesman for the U.N. humanitarian agency OCHA, told a media briefing in Geneva.
"We continue to insist that Israeli authorities' obligation under the law to facilitate delivery of aid does not stop at the border," said Laerke.

title: French nurse dubbed  Angel of Dien Bien Phu  dies aged 99
message:
French nurse dubbed ‘Angel of Dien Bien Phu’ dies aged 99Genevieve de Galard, the "Angel of Dien Bien Phu," died at 99, hailed for her "exemplary devotion" by French President Macron.
Genevieve de Galard, a nurse dubbed the “Angel of Dien Bien Phu” for treating wounded during a defining 1954 battle in then French Indochina, has died aged 99, with President Emmanuel Macron on Friday hailing her “exemplary devotion”.
One of the evacuation planes she travelled in was destroyed by gunfire when she was about to leave Dien Bien Phu.
The English translation of her memoir, The Angel of Dien Bien Phu, was published in 2010.
Defence Minister Sebastien Lecornu represented Paris at commemorations marking the 70th anniversary of Dien Bien Phu in May.

Here is your guide to the main developments in the General Election campaign on Saturday:Ms Rayner will launch her party’s battle bus (Stefan Rousseau/PA)– Rayner battle bus launchLabour leader Sir Keir Starmer, deputy leader Angela Rayner and shadow chancellor Rachel Reeves will launch Ms Rayner’s battle bus tour as they pledge to “power up” every corner of Britain.

title: Downey , Calif ., bans Pride flag on city property ; L . A . County , state officials clap back
message:
The city of Downey, Calif. — a suburb of Los Angeles — has banned the display of Pride flags and many others on city property, apparently at the urging of an anti-LGBTQ+ hate group.
But Los Angeles County and California officials are clapping back, along with some city leaders.
The City Council voted 3-2 in mid-May to allow only the U.S. flag, state flag, city flag, and the Prisoner of War/Missing in Action flag to be flown on city property, including City Hall, as reported by L.A. TV station KTLA and other outlets.
The city first flew the Pride flag three years ago, KTLA reports.
When the city first flew the Pride flag, it drew immediate opposition from Downey MassResistance members.
event_breakdown: Downey, California - The city of Downey, Calif., has banned the display of Pride flags and many others including Black Lives Matter flags on city property, apparently at the urging of an anti-LGBTQ+ hate group, Los Angeles County and California officials are clapping back, along with some city leaders.

title: Hezbollah fighters shoot down an Israeli drone in Lebanon and fire rockets at an Israeli base
message:
(AP Photo/Mohammad Zaatari)BEIRUT – The militant Hezbollah group said it shot down an Israeli drone over southern Lebanon and fired rockets at an Israeli military base on Saturday, hours after Israeli drone strikes killed at least one person and wounded several others.
Earlier Saturday, an Israeli drone strike on a motorcycle near the southern Lebanese village of Khirbet Selm wounded two people, state-run National News Agency said.
Such strikes deep inside Lebanon and far away from the Israeli border have been rare since the latest round of fighting began nearly eight months ago.
The Saturday night strike was about 100 kilometers (60 miles) from the Israeli border.
Hezbollah began attacking Israeli military posts along the Lebanon-Israel border a day after the Israel-Hamas war broke out on Oct. 7.
event_breakdown:
Hezbollah said it shot down an Israeli drone over southern Lebanon and fired rockets at a military base on Saturday, hours after Israeli drone strikes killed at least one person and wounded several others.
The Israeli drone strike on a motorcycle near the southern Lebanese village of Khirbet Selm wounded two people, state-run National News Agency said.

title: North Korea says leader Kim Jong Un supervised drills simulating preemptive attacks on South Korea - New Delhi Times - India Only International Newspaper
message:
North Korea has simulated nuclear strikes on South Korea numerous times, but the latest drills came after animosities on the Korean Peninsula rose over North Korea’s recent failed spy satellite launch.
North Korea reacted angrily, arguing that it has the sovereign right to launch satellites.
Also this week, North Korea flew hundreds of huge balloons into South Korea carrying manure and other trash, and allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in the South.
Ministry spokesperson Kim Inae said separately that South Korea “strongly condemns” North Korea for threatening preemptive strikes against the South.
The North Korean firing exercises appeared to be short-range ballistic missile test-launches that South Korea detected from North Korea’s capital region on Thursday.
event_breakdown: North Korea simulated nuclear strikes on South Korea, launched hundreds of huge balloons carrying manure and other trash into South Korea, allegedly jammed GPS navigation signals in South Korea, and threatened preemptive strikes.

title: Sheboygan police officer shoots stabbing suspect
message:
SHEBOYGAN, Wis. - A Sheboygan police officer shot a stabbing suspect, who allegedly charged at officers with a knife, on Friday, May 31.
It happened near 14th and Michigan shortly after 5 p.m. Police were initially called for a fight at an apartment.
After nearly two hours of negotiations, police said the suspect came out with a knife and charged at officers.
An officer first retreated and tried using "less-lethal means of incapacitating the suspect," police said, before shooting the suspect one time.
The Sheboygan County Sheriff's Office will handle the investigation into the officer-involved shooting, police said.

title: Ukraine war briefing : Kharkiv counts cost of Russian air strikes
message:
A Russian missile strike on residences injured 13 people including eight children in Balakliia town, Kharkiv region, on Saturday, Ukrainian prosecutors said.
A military spokesperson, Nazar Voloshin, told national television on Saturday that Ukrainian forces controlled 70% of Vovchansk, 5km (three miles) inside the border, which Russian troops have been trying to capture.

title: Osnat Abramov
message:
Condolences are offered to the family and friends of Osnat Abramov, who was killed in a suicide bombing by two Palestinian terrorists on Monday (October 21, 2002).
Osnat Abramov, an 11th grader, was on her way home after spending the day with friends in Tiberias.
The two terrorists killed 14 people and injured 42 when a car bomb loaded with about 100 pounds of nail-studded explosives was detonated next to Bus 841, traveling from Kiryat Shmona to Tel Aviv.
Osnat Abramov was a junior at the Yavne High School in Holon.
She is survived by her parents, Levi and Dora Abramov, a brother and three sisters.

title: Yemen Houthis launch 2nd strike on US aircraft carrier in less than 24 hours
message:
Sanaa: Yemen’s Houthi group claim fresh attacks on the US aircraft carrier Eisenhower, another US warship and four commercial cargo vessels in the Red Sea and Arabian Sea.
While speaking on Houthi-run al-Masirah TV, Houthi military spokesperson Yahya Sarea said it was the group’s second strike against Eisenhower in less than 24 hours.
However, there was no immediate comment from the US Navy or the targeted shipping companies, reports Xinhua news agency.
The targeted ships included MANIA, ALORAIQ, and ABLIANI.
In response, the US-British naval coalition stationed in the waters has since January conducted air raids and missile strikes against Houthi targets.
location: Based on the given information, the main location where the main event takes place is in the Red Sea.

title: How Israel raids on Jenin only fuel Palestinian resistance | Israel - Palestine conflict News
message:
On May 21, Amr Musara went out to report on Israel’s raid on the Jenin refugee camp in the Israeli-occupied West Bank.
“What I saw in Jenin camp is like Gaza on a smaller scale,” said Zaid Shuabi, a Palestinian human rights organiser in the West Bank.
In the Jenin camp, the Jenin Brigades has clashed with Israeli troops during dozens of raids.
He explained that, in particular, Israel intentionally destroys neighbourhoods, roads and homes as part of a broader strategy to displace Palestinians from the Jenin camp gradually.
More young Palestinians are joining resistance groups to avenge loved ones or to defend their families and communities from Israel’s raids, he said.

title: Police use tear gas to arrest South Lake Tahoe stabbing suspect

Police booked David Valenzuela, 43, of South Lake Tahoe on charges of assault with a deadly weapon and resisting arrest.
Valenzuela is suspected of stabbing a man police said was in stable condition late Saturday afternoon in a hospital.
Police went to Barton Memorial Hospital at about 11:15 a.m. after a man there reported being stabbed several times.
When they went to his home on Lapham Drive about a third of a mile north of the south Lake Tahoe Y he refused to surrender, police said.

title: Why the Civil War Actually Ended 16 Months After Lee Surrendered
message:
On April 9, 1865, General Robert E. Lee surrendered his Confederate troops to the Union’s Ulysses S. Grant at Appomattox Court House, Virginia, marking the beginning of the end of the grinding four-year-long American Civil War.
(Credit: Universal History Archive/Getty Images)Lee's Was Just One Confederate Army to FallFor one thing, Lee had surrendered only his Army of Northern Virginia to Grant.
A number of other Confederate forces still remained active, starting with Gen. Joseph E. Johnston’s Army of Tennessee, the second-largest Confederate army after Lee’s.
The Civil War and Its LegacyIn the biggest surrender of the Civil War, Johnston gave up around 90,000 soldiers in all—virtually all remaining Confederate troops in the Carolinas, Georgia and Florida.
Texas’s Black population had also exploded during the Civil War, since many Southern planters brought their enslaved people there to avoid them being captured by the Union Army.
event_breakdown: Lee's Surrender at Appomattox Court House

title: Russian troop losses hit record high in May , Ukraine claims
message:
Russian troop losses in May amounted to 38,940, the highest monthly figure since the start of Russia's full-scale invasion, Ukraine's Defense Ministry said on June 1.
The Defense Ministry classifies losses as including those who are killed, wounded, missing, or captured.
Leo Docherty, British minister of state for the Armed Forces, said in late April the U.K estimates Russian losses to be over 450,000.
Ukraine's Defense Ministry also claimed a record number of 1,160 Russian artillery systems destroyed in May.
According to a graph posted by the ministry on X, the previous highest number of destroyed Russian artillery pieces — 976 — was recorded in March.

title: Battlegroup East disrupts attempts to reinforce Ukrainian army frontline positions - Russian Politics & Diplomacy
message:
MOSCOW, June 2.
Russian Battlegroup East units disrupted attempts to reinforce frontline positions of the Ukrainian army, Battlegroup spokesman Alexander Gordeev told TASS.
"Battlegroup East units continue delivering combat missions in the special military operation zone.
Group units improved the frontline position during proactive actions and derailed enemy attempts to strengthen forward positions in areas of Vladimirovka, Makarovka, Belogorye, and Gulyai-Pole," the spokesman said.
Strongholds and concentration areas of Ukrainian army manpower and materiel were engaged by artillery fire and heavy flamethrower systems, he added.
event_breakdown: Russian Battlegroup East units disrupted attempts to reinforce frontline positions of the Ukrainian army. Attempts to reinforce frontline positions of the Ukrainain army were disrupted by Russian Battlegroup East units in the areas of Vladimirovka, Makarovka, Belogorye, and Gulyai-Pole.

title: Israeli strike wounds 16 children in south Lebanon
message:
The Israeli military bombarded several villages in southern and eastern Lebanon over the weekend, wounding 16 children in one air strike.
The Islamic Health Committee said that the Saturday strike on the southern village of Siddikine, located inland from the coastal city of Tyre, wounded children between the ages of four and 14.
Israel has intensified its drone strikes on Lebanon since Friday night.
Last week, three children were wounded in an Israeli drone strike in south Lebanon that killed a Hezbollah fighter in the car ahead of their school bus, blowing out the windscreen of the minibus.
Israeli attacks on Lebanon have killed almost 450 people, including at least 80 civilians, according to an AFP tally.

message:
A terrorist who planned to commit a stabbing attack in the Old City of Jerusalem and a second terrorist who planned an attack in Beit El were arrested.
The terrorist who planned an attack in the Old City, who was in Israel illegally, was arrested last week in Jerusalem.
The investigation revealed that he stole a knife from a fruit stand in the area of Old City for the purpose of carrying out the attack and hid it in his pants.
The investigation also revealed a plot by another terrorist who planned to carry out a shooting attack in the Beit El area.
The second terrorist was also arrested and confessed to the plot.

title: Video Captures Ukrainian Drone Blasting Multi - Million - Dollar Russian T - 80 Tank
message:
A video circulating on social media showcases the explosion of a Russian T-80BV tank following the arrival of a Ukrainian kamikaze drone.
The drone attacked a Russian tank near the village of Novomikhailivka in the Donetsk region.
“The most epic detonation of Russian equipment’s ammunition occurred after the arrival of a Ukrainian kamikaze drone,” read the caption of the video published on the Gruz 200 Ukrainian military Telegram channel.
The drone footage captured the detonation of the Russian tank's ammunition, which ended with the tank’s turret being torn off.
According to various open sources, a Russian T-80 tank costs 2 to 4 million dollars.
event_breakdown: Russian tank destroyed in Ukraine by a Ukrainian kamikaze drone near the village of Novomikhailivka in the Donetsk region.

title: German Islam critic stabbed in the face at rally that was livestreamed on YouTube brands knifing  an absolute nightmare  - as he warns frenzied assault was an  attack against our free democratic state
message:
An anti-Islam campaigner who was stabbed at a far-Right rally in Germany has described the rampage as an 'absolute nightmare' - as he warned the assault was an 'attack against our free democratic state'.
Michael Stuerzenberger - a well-known German Islam critic - and five others including a policeman were injured when the knifeman launched a frenzied attack in Mannheim on Friday.
Speaking for the first time from his hospital bed, Mr Stuerzenberger told BILD: 'It was like an apocalypse.
He added: 'Every attack is an attack against all of us, against our free democratic state and those who ensure our security.
Who attacks a police officer launches an attack against all of us.'
event_breakdown: Mannheim, Germany

title: Nine wounded in Russia by Ukrainian strikes : governors
message:
MOSCOW, June 2, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Nine people were wounded in Ukrainian strikes on the Russian border regions of Belgorod and Kursk, the respective regional governors said on Sunday.
"Six civilians were wounded as a result of the bombardment of Shebekino town," Belgorod governor Vyacheslav Gladkov said on Telegram, adding that they had been taken to hospital.
All six, five of whom were in two buses and the sixth who was on the street, were wounded by shrapnel.
Shebekino is a town of 40,000 people close to the border with Ukraine, fewer than 100 kilometres (60 miles) from Kharkiv.
Meanwhile, a Ukrainian drone attack "on a car this morning" in the Kursk region "wounded three" people, who were taken to hospital, governor Alexei Smirnov said.

title: 2 dead , 7 injured after  altercation  and shooting at Pittsburgh bar
message:
PENN HILLS, Pa.— A shooting at a bar in suburban Pittsburgh has left two people dead and seven others injured, police said Sunday.
First responders discovered the bodies of an adult male and adult female inside the bar around 3 a.m. Sunday.
Two people were fatally shot at a suburban Pittsburgh bar.
Preliminary information shows “an altercation took place inside the bar and multiple individuals opened fire,” county police said.
Anyone with information concerning this incident is asked to call the County Police Tip Line 1-833-ALL-TIPS.

title: Man stabbed ex 17 times then told 6 - year - old daughter teacher hed  ended her
message:
Leon Murray confessed to the murder after he arrived at the school to collect his daughter following the brutal attack on his ex-partner Keisha Christodoulou.
A court heard how Murray went to their flat in Deptford the day after Keisha, 32, ended the relationship on October 31, 2022.
He savagely attacked her with a knife, stabbing her 17 times and leaving her on the living room floor before changing his clothes and going to collect their daughter from school, MyLondon reports.
At the school, he told a staff member that ‘it is done’ and that he had “ended” Keisha.
“Tackling violence against women is one of our top priorities and we will continue in our efforts to bring dangerous perpetrators like Murray to justice.

title: One man in custody after house fire in Wahpeton
message:
WAHPETON, N.D. — One man has been charged in connection with a fire that tore through his residence here Saturday evening, June 1.
Wahpeton Police said they received a report of a house on fire on the 500 block of Sixth Street North.
The Wahpeton Fire Department was able to put out the fire, but the home received extensive damage.
Police said one of the residents, Adam Lief Erickson, of Wahpeton, was arrested on charges of endangering by fire or explosion.
The Richland County Sheriff's Office, Breckenridge/Wahpeton Ambulance, Richland County Emergency Management, Wahpeton Street Department, Ottertail Power and Great Plains Natural Gas assisted at the scene.

message:
A man has been shot and injured in what police believe is a targeted attack.
The victim, in his 30s, self-presented at hospital after suffering a leg injury in the attack in Ormonde Crescent, Kirkby, at about 21:00 BST on Saturday, Merseyside Police said.
He is in a serious but stable condition.
Police appealed for information, saying “a group of males” in black clothing were riding bikes on the road just before the shooting.
They then fled towards Mintor Road and Simonswood Lane.

title: North Korea Sends New Wave of 720 Trash - Filled Balloons Into South Korea
message:
North Korea floated another 720 trash-filled balloons into South Korea, local reports said.
Kim Yo Jong, sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong Un, called the balloons "sincere presents."
AdvertisementNorth Korea launched another 720 balloons across its border with South Korea Saturday night, carrying plastic bags full of cigarette butts, scraps of cloth, and waste paper.
Pyongyang says it was retaliation for activists sending anti-North Korean leaflets and USB drives containing K-pop music across the border.
South Korea's Yonhap News Agency said 720 balloons carrying trash were floated into the country, while Reuters quoted a figure of 600.
event_breakdown: North Korea: Pyongyang floats more 720 balloons carrying trash into South Korea.

title: U . S . Airstrike in Puntland Kills Three ISIS Militants and Destroys Camps
message:
Friday’s U.S. airstrike in Puntland killed three ISIS militants and destroyed the group’s army camps in Af Cas village, located 80 km southeast of Bosaso town, reported Somalia’s Deputy Minister of Information, Abdirahman Yusuf Al-Addala.
The Minister, speaking with VOA Somali, said the airstrike followed an attack carried out a week ago in the Almadow area of the Bari region in Puntland State.
Several people were rescued, and there were no civilian casualties in the operation conducted by American forces.
“Somalia remains central to the security environment in East Africa.
U.S. Africa Command’s forces will continue training, advising, and equipping partner forces to degrade ISIS,” the spokesperson added.
event_breakdown: U.S. airstrike kills three ISIS militants in Somalia

title: War in the north | Firefighters fighting blazes caused by rockets and drones
message:
השריפה בצפון דוברות כבאות והצלה18 firefighting crews worked on Sunday in several locations after several missiles and drones landed near Qatzrin in the Golan Heights and Yiftah in the Galilee.
15 missiles were launched from Lebanon toward Qatzrin in the Golan Heights, at least four missiles were found to have landed in open areas.
Hezbollah claims the attack was aimed at an Iron Dome radar in the area.
In addition, Two unmanned aircraft launched by Hezbollah on Sunday were not intercepted and exploded near Akko (Acre) and Nehariya on Israel's norther-western coast.
In the morning, eight missiles were launched from Lebanon and were intercepted.

title: Zelenskyy believes US should allow Ukraine to strike Russia with ATACMS missiles
message:
Zelenskyy believes US should allow Ukraine to strike Russia with ATACMS missilesPresident Volodymyr Zelenskyy believes that the United States should allow Ukraine to strike military targets in Russia with long-range ATACMS missiles.
Quote from Zelenskyy: "Is that [the permission] sufficient?
Because I have given you the example of airfields from which Russia is permanently firing, in calm knowing that Ukraine will not fire back because it has no corresponding systems and no permissions."
Details: He added that Russia continues to use long-range artillery and about 300 weapons systems with tens of thousands of missiles on its side of the border to attack Ukraine.
"So they have these weapons there and they do not remove them because they know that Ukraine cannot target them with Western weaponry even if they fire against us," the president explained.
event_breakdown:
1. Russia announced on Saturday that it would allow foreign companies to locally store their corporate data and order Russian-based servers.
2. Moscow lifted a ban on the establishment of new international airways following the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic.
3. Russia's Defense Ministry reported on Saturday that Ukrainian forces opened fire on Russian border units' armored personnel carriers in Donbas.
4. Almaz-Antey, a defense contracting company that produces state-of-the-art weaponry - including air defense systems and electronic warfare gear – will relocate to the Moscow Region from Tatarstan in July, its director general, Yan Novikov, announced on Saturday.
5. Russian fighter jets flew along the southwestern coast of Crimea on Saturday, the military agency said in a statement.
6. A Moscow city court announced on Saturday it overturned a ban on Russia's Orthodox Christian church in Ukraine.
7. A Moscow court fined Alibaba, an e-commerce company, $467,000 on Saturday for not removing prohibited content.
8. Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov announced on Saturday that Russian and Tajik specialists will work together to ensure the safety of Afghanistan's president.
9. The Syrian government has taken steps to step up its presence near the   Syria-Turkey border, with the aim of limiting Ankara's control over the region.
10. Belarusian and Russian prime ministers will continue to talk in Moscow on Saturday.

title: Israel attacks Hezbollah military base in Lebanon
message:
Beirut, June 2 : Israeli warplanes attacked on Sunday a military base used by Hezbollah to launch assault drones against Israeli army targets, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
Israeli warplanes fired three air-to-surface missiles at a Hezbollah military base located in the west of the city of Baalbek in eastern Lebanon, about 80 km from the borderline separating Lebanon and Israel, the sources said on condition of anonymity.
Also on Sunday morning, Israeli warplanes launched three raids on the southeast villages of Kfarhamam, Rachaya al Foukhar, and Halta, injuring 18 civilians, including nine children, the sources added.
Meanwhile, Hezbollah said its fighters on Sunday morning attacked the Yarden military base in Golan Heights, targeting the Iron Dome radar and stationing areas of officers and soldiers.
Tensions along the Lebanon-Israel border escalated on October 8, 2023, following a barrage of rockets launched by Hezbollah toward Israel in solidarity with Hamas' attack on Israel the day before.
event_breakdown: IDF air strike on Hezbollah base in Lebanon.

Israeli warplanes fired three air-to-surface missiles at a Hezbollah military base located in the west of the city of Baalbek in eastern Lebanon, about 80 km from the borderline separating Lebanon and Israel, the sources said on condition of anonymity.

title: Energy shutdowns hit Ukraine after Russian attacks target infrastructure
message:
(AP Photo/Alexander Zemlianichenko)KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukraine imposed emergency power shutdowns in most of the country on Sunday, a day after Russia unleashed large-scale attacks on energy infrastructure and claimed it made gains in the eastern Donetsk province.
The shutdowns were in place in all but three regions of Ukraine following Saturday's drone and missile attack on energy targets that injured at least 19 people.
Ukraine’s state-owned power grid operator Ukrenergo said the shutdowns affected both industrial and household consumers.
Sustained Russian attacks on Ukraine’s power grid in recent weeks have forced the government to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.
In Russia, six people were injured in shelling in the city of Shebekino in the Belgorod region bordering Ukraine, regional Gov.
event_breakdown: Ukraine imposed emergency power shutdowns in most of the country on Sunday, a day after Russia unleashed large-scale attacks on energy infrastructure and claimed it made gains in the eastern Donetsk province. The shutdowns were in place in all but three regions of Ukraine following Saturday's drone and missile attack on energy targets that injured at least 19 people. Ukraine's state-owned power grid operator Ukrenergo said the shutdowns affected both industrial and household consumers. Sustained Russian attacks on Ukraine's power grid in recent weeks have forced the government to institute nationwide rolling blackouts. In Russia, six people were injured in shelling in the city of Shebekino in the Belgorod region bordering Ukraine, regional Gov. Vyacheslav Gladkov said on Sunday. In Ukraine's neighboring Chernihiv region, the Russian army hit two villages overnight, causing civilian and military casualties, regional Governor Viacheslav Chaus said on social media. In the eastern Luhansk region, at least one person was killed and three were wounded in a Russian attack, the region’s governor, Serhiy Haidai, said Sunday.

title: Energy shutdowns hit Ukraine after Russian attacks target infrastructure

Ukraine has imposed emergency power shutdowns in most of the country a day after Russia unleashed large-scale attacks on energy infrastructure and claimed it made gains in the eastern Donetsk provinceBy SAMYA KULLAB Associated Press and ELISE MORTON Associated PressKYIV, Ukraine -- Ukraine imposed emergency power shutdowns in most of the country on Sunday, a day after Russia unleashed large-scale attacks on energy infrastructure and claimed it made gains in the eastern Donetsk province.
The shutdowns were in place in all but three regions of Ukraine following Saturday's drone and missile attack on energy targets that injured at least 19 people.
Ukraine’s state-owned power grid operator Ukrenergo said the shutdowns affected both industrial and household consumers.
Sustained Russian attacks on Ukraine’s power grid in recent weeks have forced the government to institute nationwide rolling blackouts.
Russia claimed Sunday that it had taken control of the village of Umanske in the partially Russian-occupied Donetsk region.

title: Bereaved families :  We will not agree to any capitulation to Hamas
message:
"We, the bereaved families, will not agree to any capitulation to Hamas.
We will not accept any capitulation to Hamas, we will not agree that our loved ones be the silver platter for the restoration of terror rule to Gaza.

title: True meanings of Palestinian Statehood
message:
The world has begun to make significant decisions on Palestinian Arab statehood.
The Palestinian Arab leadership, whether Hamas[8] or Fatah, has persistently sought to make “martyrs” of unwitting Gaza Palestinian Arabs for corrosively propagandistic benefit.
As it is presently imagined, a Palestinian state – any Palestinian state - would offer a more opportunistic launching point for existential terror attacks and enemy state attacks against Israel.
Summing up, a Palestinian state – any Palestinian state - would represent a reward for criminal terrorism and simultaneously institutionalize an ongoing source of criminal defilement.
Accordingly, Palestinian Arab statehood should be rejected on both legal and policy grounds by the civilized community of nations.

title: Northern Belle returning to Norwich ahead of Derbyshire trip
message:
Passengers will board the 1930s Pullman-style Northern Belle at Norwich Station on Thursday.
The trip will take passengers to visit a Derbyshire stately home (Image: Sonya Duncan)The experience, which ranges in cost from £250 to £700, will also offer passengers the chance to visit either Chatsworth House or the neighbouring Hardwick Hall.
Out of the 210 people who will be attending the sell-out trip, 166 chose Chatsworth House and only 46 opted for Hardwick Hall.
It will be back in Norwich in September for a Champagne lunch or afternoon tea trip followed by an excursion to York and Scarborough.
For more details and to book visit the Northern Belle website.
event_breakdown:
Northern Belle, a 1930s Pullman-style train, will be operating a trip out of Norwich on Thursday, June 23rd.
The trip offers passengers the opportunity to visit either Chatsworth House or Hardwick Hall. Chatsworth House is located in Derbyshire while Hardwick Hall is a neighbouring stately home.
Northern Belle will offer the journey at a high cost, ranging from £250 to £700 per person.
The train will be back in Norwich in September for a Champagne lunch or afternoon tea trip, followed by an excursion to York and Scarborough.

title: Ukraine is running short of people
message:
A mobilisation law that went into effect last month is aimed at replenishing Ukraine’s military ranks with hundreds of thousands of troops.
“We are now in a war of attrition,” Ukrainian Deputy Central Bank Governor Sergiy Nikolaychuk said in an interview in Kyiv.
The hiring process is made cumbersome because male staff are reluctant to join large companies targeted by military recruiters.
Ukraine’s Economy, Finance and Defense Ministries declined to comment on the issue.
“The reason is simple: Ukraine doesn’t have enough funds to significantly increase its troops,” Landa said.
event_breakdown: Ukraine mobilises troops with a hiring process that slows down replenishment.
